National_Security_Element: Henrie's membership in organizations deemed threats to national security
National_Security_Danger: Disclosure of classified information would harm national security
Threat_Assessment: Organizations Henrie was involved with were considered security threats
Risk_Factor: Membership in organizations posing potential risk to national security
Nature_of_Acts: Affiliation with groups perceived as threats to national security
Organization_Involved: Organizations deemed threats to national security (specific names not disclosed due to classification)
Individual_Behavior: Association with groups under surveillance for national security concerns
Key_Evidence_Issue: Whether classified information can be withheld without violating applicant's rights
Credibility_Factors: Relevance and importance of evidence to national security
Credibility_Assessment: Court determined the evidence posed a genuine threat if disclosed
Evidence_Issues: Non-disclosure of classified information in administrative review
Standard_of_Proof: Balance between procedural fairness and national security protection
Legal_Provision: Section 36.2 of the Canada Evidence Act
Legal_Provision_Cited: Section 36.2 of the Canada Evidence Act
Governing_Provision: Section 36.2 of the Canada Evidence Act
Legal_Standard: Judicial review of objections to disclosure based on national security
Decision_Outcome: Application to disclose classified information dismissed
Process: Security clearance review with classified evidence evaluation
Procedural_Element: Hearings before SIRC and Federal Court
Procedural_Issue: Withholding of classified information from applicant
Standard_of_Review: Judicial review of national security-based nondisclosure
Review_Standard: Whether nondisclosure is justified to protect national security
